paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Torsades de pointes episode, prolonged QTc interval

individual_records.phenotype_details: experienced Torsades de pointes and prolonged QTc interval of 560 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The genetic analysis identified that the patient and her father had heterozygous mutations in KCNH2 (c.1370C>T) and AKAP9 (c.7725A>C).

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc interval of 490 ms, no arrhythmia reported
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The genetic inheritance analysis further verified that the patient and her father, with a QTc interval of 490 ms, had heterozygous mutations in the genes KCNH2 (c.1370C>T) and AKAP9 (c.7725A>C).

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 mutation is associated with a decrease in IKr activity, contributing to prolonged QT intervals.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the proband and her father.
variants.additional_notes: The mother had no relevant genetic mutations detected.
key_quotes: The genetic analysis identified that the patient and her father had heterozygous mutations in KCNH2 (c.1370C>T).
The genetic inheritance analysis further verified that the patient and her father, with a QTc interval of 490 ms, had heterozygous mutations in the genes KCNH2 (c.1370C>T).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
